class.name: Curve
class.description: This resource describes a mathematical curve by defining a set of points and tangents at each point. By default, it ranges between [code]0[/code] and [code]1[/code] on the X and Y axes, but these ranges can be changed. Please note that many resources and nodes assume they are given [i]unit curves[/i]. A unit curve is a curve whose domain (the X axis) is between [code]0[/code] and [code]1[/code]. Some examples of unit curve usage are [member CPUParticles2D.angle_curve] and [member Line2D.width_curve].

method.name: add_point
method.description: Adds a point to the curve. For each side, if the [code]*_mode[/code] is [constant TANGENT_LINEAR], the [code]*_tangent[/code] angle (in degrees) uses the slope of the curve halfway to the adjacent point. Allows custom assignments to the [code]*_tangent[/code] angle if [code]*_mode[/code] is set to [constant TANGENT_FREE].

method.name: bake
method.description: Recomputes the baked cache of points for the curve.

method.name: clean_dupes
method.description: Removes duplicate points, i.e. points that are less than 0.00001 units (engine epsilon value) away from their neighbor on the curve.

method.name: clear_points
method.description: Removes all points from the curve.

method.name: get_domain_range
method.description: Returns the difference between [member min_domain] and [member max_domain].

method.name: get_point_left_mode
method.description: Returns the left [enum TangentMode] for the point at [param index].

method.name: get_point_left_tangent
method.description: Returns the left tangent angle (in degrees) for the point at [param index].

method.name: get_point_position
method.description: Returns the curve coordinates for the point at [param index].

method.name: get_point_right_mode
method.description: Returns the right [enum TangentMode] for the point at [param index].

method.name: get_point_right_tangent
method.description: Returns the right tangent angle (in degrees) for the point at [param index].

method.name: get_value_range
method.description: Returns the difference between [member min_value] and [member max_value].

method.name: remove_point
method.description: Removes the point at [param index] from the curve.

method.name: sample
method.description: Returns the Y value for the point that would exist at the X position [param offset] along the curve.

method.name: sample_baked
method.description: Returns the Y value for the point that would exist at the X position [param offset] along the curve using the baked cache. Bakes the curve's points if not already baked.

method.name: set_point_left_mode
method.description: Sets the left [enum TangentMode] for the point at [param index] to [param mode].

method.name: set_point_left_tangent
method.description: Sets the left tangent angle for the point at [param index] to [param tangent].

method.name: set_point_offset
method.description: Sets the offset from [code]0.5[/code].

method.name: set_point_right_mode
method.description: Sets the right [enum TangentMode] for the point at [param index] to [param mode].

method.name: set_point_right_tangent
method.description: Sets the right tangent angle for the point at [param index] to [param tangent].

method.name: set_point_value
method.description: Assigns the vertical position [param y] to the point at [param index].

members.member: The number of points to include in the baked (i.e. cached) curve data.
The maximum domain (x-coordinate) that points can have.
The maximum value (y-coordinate) that points can have. Tangents can cause higher values between points.
The minimum domain (x-coordinate) that points can have.
The minimum value (y-coordinate) that points can have. Tangents can cause lower values between points.
The number of points describing the curve.

signal.name: domain_changed
signal.description: Emitted when [member max_domain] or [member min_domain] is changed.

signal.name: range_changed
signal.description: Emitted when [member max_value] or [member min_value] is changed.

constants.constant: The tangent on this side of the point is user-defined.

The total number of available tangent modes.
